items.sentence: Tom couldn't remember where he'd left his keys.
I was confused by the expression on Tom's face.
Don't throw that bottle away. It can be reused.
I've been trying to figure out what went wrong.
Isn't this the first time that that's happened?
Tom seemed to be flattered by Mary's attention.
There's no room in my closet for anything else.
Why don't we talk about what you did in Boston?
Why don't we talk about what's going to happen?
Tom stood in the corner of the room by himself.
Tom still hasn't decided what he's going to do.
Tom showed me the letter he'd gotten from Mary.
Tom should be able to do everything by himself.
Tom refused to tell Mary what she needed to do.
Tom read the letter and then handed it to Mary.
Tom ran back to his bedroom and started crying.
Tom quite often borrows money from his friends.
We're expecting Tom to leave sometime tomorrow.
We expect Tom to get back home on October 20th.
Tom, Mary, John and Alice were all very hungry.
